zone.line: A spirit from my heart bursts forth
It clothes with unexpected birth
My cold bare bosom-- oh, it must be thine
On mine, on mine!
Gazing on thee I feel I know
Green stalks burst forth, & bright flowers
grow
And living shapes upon my bosom move
Music is in the sea & air
Winged clouds soar here & there
Dark with the rain new buds are dreaming
of
'Tis Love, all Love!
The Earth
It interpenetrates my granite mass
Through tangled roots & trodden clay doth pass
Into the utmost leaves & delicat{es}t flowers{--}
Upon the winds, among the clouds 'tis spread
It wakes a life in the forgotten dead
They breathe a spirit up from their
obscurest bowers
And like a storm, bursting its cloudy
prison
With thunder & with whirlwind, has
arisen
